nl.hanze.sjet.model

Class Wolf

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.hanze.sjet.model.Animal
      • nl.hanze.sjet.model.Wolf
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Actor

    public class Wolf
extends Animal
    A simple model of a fox. Foxes age, move, eat rabbits, and die.
    Version:
    22-01-2015
    Author:
    Jan A. Germeraad

    • Constructor Detail

      • Wolf

        public Wolf(boolean randomAge,
            Field field,
            Location location)
        Create a wolf. A wolf can be created as a new born (age zero and not hungry) or with a random age and food level.
        Parameters:
        randomAge - If true, the wolf will have random age and hunger level.
        field - The field currently occupied.
        location - The location within the field.

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act(java.util.List<Actor> newWolves)
        Lets the wolf act. It ages, gets hungry, may give birth and tries to hunt.
        Specified by:
        act in interface Actor
        Specified by:
        act in class Animal
        Parameters:
        field - The field currently occupied.
        newWolves - A list to return newly born wolves.
